title: Can you read the Harry Potter books on repeat? - Quora

response.answer_text: Can you read the Harry Potter books on repeat? Yes I have, I actually read them two times in a row to my son then daughter. Due to the fact both have their favorites I read the “Goblet of Fire”, “Order of the Phoenix”, “The Half Blood Prince”, and “The Deathly Hallows” three times. I actually really love them and I’m 42 years old! I have to tell anybody reading if your basing the enjoyment of these characters, stories, and world on only the movies you are seriously missing out. Try the Audio books if reading isn’t your thing but trust me they are fantastic and everytime I have gone through them I found something I previously missed. My daughter is now 5 and son is 10 so I’m hoping to talk her into one more go around before she gets to old for Daddy..
Yes yes yes! I’m sixteen years old and started the books when I was eleven, over the time I’ve read the books seventeen times. Every time I reread it I find something new. So yes you can reread it.

You can - I do. I am almost always in some state of Harry Potter-ing. I have other books I read, too, but lots of Potter. And I almost always have the audiobooks on as background noise during the day - just on a loop. I’m familiar enough with the story that I can listen to it while I’m working or gaming without being too distracted.
I have no idea what you are asking. Are you asking if people read the books again, after the first time? Of course!
Always  P.S: my answer is very short, it actually just a word
